It 's a commonly held view in temporal semantics that in order to treat many temporal phenomena , one must do justice to the rich structures underlying temporal ontology .The classical work in this area is Vendler 's ( 1967 ) , though the ideas stretch back much earlier ( Aristotle ) , and have been developed in many directions since ( e.g. , Moens and Steedman 1988 , Nakhimovsky 1988 , Lascarides 1991 ) .

It seems important to try and find unifying perspectives on this work , and above all , to try and gain some insight into the logical resources needed to deal with natural language temporal phenomena .In this paper , we show how a wide variety of temporal expressions can be analysed using a simple modal language .
